title: Question:
author: BenCodie
content: I believe we are in the times where it's very possible for the fiat system to implode, and for Bitcoin to go on a rally that simply leaves everyone who does not own any behind. It's been over 15 years, people have had the chance to allocate fiat to Bitcoin as a form of protection and wealth creation, though it seems like the days where it's painful or detrimental for those not owning any Bitcoin is imminent...Which prompts me to ask the question:How much time do you think is left to buy Bitcoin before not owning any leads to demise, detriment, or worse, poverty/financial slavery?

comments.author: Russlenat
comments.body: Your fear will only come true if massive inflation hits most countries and only a few nations try to control the world. Then we might start using Bitcoin for transactions as a way to fight inflation. But that's not why most people buy Bitcoin. Most long-term holders believe Bitcoin will bring them profit, and they still trust fiat money for everyday transactions. Even if there are signs that inflation might rise soon, for now, the inflation rate is still tolerable in most big countries, so it doesn't really scare ordinary people.

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Quote from: BenCodie on February 13, 2025, 01:06:53 PMHow much time do you think is left to buy Bitcoin before not owning any leads to demise, detriment, or worse, poverty/financial slavery?It's not a good question because it there is time for too late to own bitcoin, it will be a time for Bitcoin death when no new people want to be participants of this market and want to bring new capital to this market.The market only can grow if it is attractive enough to have new participants, and new capital flow. If it is only outflow, no new inflow, it will become dead with time. It's logic with all markets but fortunately, I see that Bitcoin demand will increase with time, and it's just late comers will have to buy bitcoin at more expensive prices.I don't think with late comers, it will hurt them, as said, if it is hurtful for them, there will be no demand to join this market in future.

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.body: Quote from: hd49728 on February 13, 2025, 01:36:01 PMQuote from: BenCodie on February 13, 2025, 01:06:53 PMHow much time do you think is left to buy Bitcoin before not owning any leads to demise, detriment, or worse, poverty/financial slavery?It's not a good question because it there is time for too late to own bitcoin, it will be a time for Bitcoin death when no new people want to be participants of this market and want to bring new capital to this market.The market only can grow if it is attractive enough to have new participants, and new capital flow. If it is only outflow, no new inflow, it will become dead with time. It's logic with all markets but fortunately, I see that Bitcoin demand will increase with time, and it's just late comers will have to buy bitcoin at more expensive prices.I don't think with late comers, it will hurt them, as said, if it is hurtful for them, there will be no demand to join this market in future.Yes, however I think you missed the question. I'm sure we can agree, at some point, Bitcoin will be extremely expensive. For one who owns none, they have a severe disadvantage. The time at which this disadvantage exists, is at the time it hurts for not owning it. The reason why I think this is soon, is due to the very poor economic state globally, as well as the potential fall of the US dollar/debt explosion being closer than what we may think. Quote from: Russlenat on February 13, 2025, 01:23:54 PMYour fear will only come true if massive inflation hits most countries and only a few nations try to control the world. Then we might start using Bitcoin for transactions as a way to fight inflation. But that's not why most people buy Bitcoin. Most long-term holders believe Bitcoin will bring them profit, and they still trust fiat money for everyday transactions. Even if there are signs that inflation might rise soon, for now, the inflation rate is still tolerable in most big countries, so it doesn't really scare ordinary people.My fear is for the masses...It's a scary thought to think what an implosion of fiat will do to those who have no bitcoin, or who have debt, or worse, both. If we look at Weimar Republic, it only took 2 years to reach hyperinflation...most countries are already experiencing higher than normal inflation numbers.

comments.author: HeRetiK
comments.body: As much as I love Bitcoin I think it's unlikely for all fiat currencies to implode at the same time, at least anytime soon. For now any collapsing fiat currency will more likely lead to people fleeing to other fiat currencies. This is unlikely to change until Bitcoin starts to play a larger role in international trade. If that happens, the clock will start ticking fast.Quote from: BenCodie on February 13, 2025, 02:03:28 PMMy fear is for the masses...It's a scary thought to think what an implosion of fiat will do to those who have no bitcoin, or who have debt, or worse, both.Upside: In your scenario having (fiat-denominated) debt is a good thing, actually.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: For an average Joe who probably is aware of the existence of BTC as a long term profitable asset and still doubts if it's a scam or something real, then I don't think we should worry much about them. The younger generations are up coming and they have to be aware of such investments like bitcoin, so that they would know how to use it when the time comes. For me I would say, there isn't actually any amount of time required for average Joe. As soon as he becomes aware of BTC and has enough funds to start investing, then he should go for it as soon as possible.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: For the role that bitcoin is playing or will play as a peer to peer payment system I don’t think there is anytime to actually own bitcoin which will render it late. But as an investment or an asset one buys to make profit out I will simply say the more years it keeps going or the more demands coming the time left to get it at a discount price will be reducing. To actually put a time scale will be hard because the usa case of bitcoin is definitely going to make it grow in value everyday, but my prediction will be that as long as bitcoin isn’t mined entirely then it is not late to actually buy and make multiple profits from it. This doesn’t mean after the mining is done it wouldn’t still be a good buy but I believe it will be more scarce then

comments.author: lizarder
comments.body: Quote from: BenCodie on February 13, 2025, 01:06:53 PMI believe we are in the times where it's very possible for the fiat system to implode, and for Bitcoin to go on a rally that simply leaves everyone who does not own any behind. It's been over 15 years, people have had the chance to allocate fiat to Bitcoin as a form of protection and wealth creation, though it seems like the days where it's painful or detrimental for those not owning any Bitcoin is imminent...Which prompts me to ask the question:How much time do you think is left to buy Bitcoin before not owning any leads to demise, detriment, or worse, poverty/financial slavery? As much as possible and as long as we can plan to start and most importantly how that desire can grow based on bitcoin’s performance which continues to show much better resilience going forward and if you don’t want to be left behind then you can start planning to buy it now. The question is how much time does it take for someone to start getting involved in the investment because the only reason we often hear is not having the money to buy it.If bitcoin can provide financial freedom to achieve a much better life, then all means must be done and there is no need to wait for the right time as long as we have money we can buy it in any amount and in my opinion it is not too late if we want to build financial freedom to be better.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Quote from: BenCodie on February 13, 2025, 01:06:53 PMHow much time do you think is left to buy Bitcoin before not owning any leads to demise, detriment, or worse, poverty/financial slavery?We are already on that point, aren't we? At least for me, personally, if I wasn't immersed into Bitcoin investment for almost a decade, I would be facing serious and concerning financial issues right now, with low thriving perspectives, added to demotivation, due to every other problems we also face in different aspects of life.However, it's important to highlight a good moment to start investing in BTC is during the bearish season. This market works in cycles, and to invest during the peak of the bullish cycle is only worthy if you have long term goals in mind. So, I would wait the current trend to cease to invest again.Just make sure to not miss the train next time, because we never know if it's going to be the last.

comments.author: Lida93
comments.body: Sincerely, most people still trust the fiat more than they do with bitcoin as a result of the obvious that bitcoin hasn't gained a global trust as much as the US dollar for instance has. Probably why people are mostly advised to maintain an investment in bitcoin to an amount they can afford to lose because it is not without risk owing to its volatility and market uncertainties that greatly shapes and determines the price of the coin. But having said that, BTC is one digital asset anyone should hodl as investment for the future in this contemporary time.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: 10 years+ I guess, but it can be quicker if there's an another something like Covid19 or World War 3.Many countries didn't suffer high inflation, they're still at moderate, although many people are struggling, but they can still able to live. They still have many choice to hedge against inflation too like stock, gold etc.Not owning Bitcoin will not leads poverty, even though Bitcoin might be the best investment.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: Quote from: BenCodie on February 13, 2025, 01:06:53 PMHow much time do you think is left to buy Bitcoin before not owning any leads to demise, detriment, or worse, poverty/financial slavery?There are many times remain to buy Bitcoin. Let's not pressure anyone to put them in a position to buy Bitcoin by means without having a basic knowledge of Bitcoin. By the way, millions of people on earth don't owe any Bitcoin, and they are living their lives without thinking of having bad encounters of not investing in Bitcoin.Not investing in Bitcoin doesn't turn out to be the worst for anyone. Not everyone on earth will love to invest in Bitcoin. Anyone who feels to have a risk of investing in Bitcoin, let them go ahead at any time they feel like, not proclaim negative thoughts to them

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: The way the poll is framed and the question is raised doesn't allow for answering that it will not happen and it's not a matter of 10+ years, even.Bitcoin is a choice, a matter of freedom. The question of buying Bitcoin is a question of the price and the amount to buy, and that's how it will be in the future as well.I don't think there will be a time when you're too late to buy and are truly suffering from not owning Bitcoin.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: When bitcoin hits 7 digits, those who are poor might be weak to invest in bitcoin because it will look very expensive to them and getting the money to buy bitcoin might be a problem to them due to high level of inflation. At that point in time, the volatility of bitcoin will reduce because I believe it reduces overtime. For those who can afford it, they will buy but they will still regret that they didn't buy earlier.

comments.author: traderethereum
comments.body: You don't need to worry with that because you can still buy Bitcoin at the exchange or P2P. As long as you have fiat money to buy Bitcoin, that will not be a problem for you even if the economic almost collapse or Bitcoin price is at very high price. But it is better you start now and use DCA method to buy Bitcoin and determine how long you will invest in Bitcoin. Or you can buy Bitcoin every time the price is at a low price because that is happen many times now. By buying Bitcoin right now, your chance to have Bitcoin will be wide open and that is happen before something bad happen.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Quote from: BenCodie on February 13, 2025, 01:06:53 PMI believe we are in the times where it's very possible for the fiat system to implode, and for Bitcoin to go on a rally that simply leaves everyone who does not own any behind. It's been over 15 years, people have had the chance to allocate fiat to Bitcoin as a form of protection and wealth creation, though it seems like the days where it's painful or detrimental for those not owning any Bitcoin is imminent...Which prompts me to ask the question:How much time do you think is left to buy Bitcoin before not owning any leads to demise, detriment, or worse, poverty/financial slavery?There is no time left than now, this have to do with our investment plan anyway, since bitcoin has come to stay, anytime could be suitable and even later in the future, but we would have missed out on buying the dip from where it is now compared to where it is going in the future.We don't have a specific time that we must buy or invest on bitcoin and the same way for the release of this same digital coin for selling, however, if we want to be more professional in dealing with it and also want to avoid much risk on losses, then we must understand the way it works, the seasons available and the market circles, know how the volatility works, define when best to invest base on the perfect seasonal timing, lastly, we must know the kind of investor we are, if we are going into trading, or long term investment in bitcoin before making any decision.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: BenCodie on February 13, 2025, 01:06:53 PMHow much time do you think is left to buy Bitcoin before not owning any leads to demise, detriment, or worse, poverty/financial slavery?It is becoming very difficult to set aside funds weekly or monthly from your earnings. The global economic crisis have made inflation to go high and making workers to spend all they have earned on basic needs. I think there is still time since the price of Bitcoin has not gone too high that someone wouldn't be able to adopt the DCA method to acquire Bitcoin.  Some people who know the potential of Bitcoin are seeking other sources of revenue to invest in it. The price has gotten above $100k and might get to $150k before the end of the bull run. I can't predict how the next four years will turn out to be. My conclusion is that since Bitcoin can be bought in bits, there is still time to buy the coin.

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: For the average Joe or Jane who wants to become a "Wholecoiner" I think its alreadytoo late, who has $100,000 floating around to just buy a Bitcoin? So owning Satoshi's is achievable to everyone and thats regardless of its marketprice. Whether it goes to $200,000 or $500,000, it just means you get less for thesame amount of FIAT.Also - there are the majority of people who either dont think about their future,have no savings plan or outlook or who are happy with their FIAT savings andhave no desire to get into Bitcoin - thats going to be the case. I believe usBitcoiners will always be in a minority.

comments.author: coolcoinz
comments.body: It already hurts. Just put yourself in the shoes of an average minimum wage worker who hears that if they invested $1000 in bitcoin 5 years ago, they'd now own 0.2 BTC, worth $25k, which equals to roughly 2 years of working 9-5! That's rough and it definitely hurts to know it. If you're asking how long before not owning it will lead to poverty, the answer is probably over 10 years, unless the country you live in goes to war or bankrupt.

comments.author: Smartvirus
comments.body: Quote from: BenCodie on February 13, 2025, 01:06:53 PMWhich prompts me to ask the question:How much time do you think is left to buy Bitcoin before not owning any leads to demise, detriment, or worse, poverty/financial slavery?If it already hurts now to buy Bitcoin with the current price at this time, then everyone out there looking to invest should do so now and do it with what they have and can afford to lose. It’s the right means to gradually build a portfolio.Bitcoin has come so far in such a short time and the time gets shorter even more as citizens discover and rediscover the currency. Don’t forget, compared to the number of persons that are invested in Bitcoin, we are very much in an early stage that could quickly transcend beyond our dreamed price.
